Just picked up Perilous Wilds which is just great. Also have Class Warfare. What other books, settings,playbooks,etc should I be on the lookout for?
<div id='comment z13rvn0pzm3gvx5or04ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/112861727035740900905_photo.jpg'> Gerard Snow</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-02-03 14:29:27 (edited: 2018-02-03 14:29:27)</cite></p>
        <p>Stonetop.  One of the finest DW settings with Amazing magic items and classes.  Definitely worth a look.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13rvn0pzm3gvx5or04ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/116013665970125878211_photo.jpg'> Yochai Gal</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-02-03 14:47:49 (edited: 2018-02-03 14:47:49)</cite></p>
        <p>Book of Beasts, Perilous Deeps, Minimal Playkit Plus, Minimal GM companion.<br /><br />Actually just look at the Syllabus section Suggested Supplements.<br /><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ORjM3sxhQrwNI_chlNzYFMD5OFHj7u-Rs_gY4kHkzO0/edit" data-embed="_-hFoaHR0cHM6Ly9kb2NzLmdvb2dsZS5jb20vZG9jdW1lbnQvZC8xT1JqTTNzeGhRcndOSV9jaGxOellGTUQ1T0ZIajd1LVJzX2dZNGtIa3pPMC9lZGl0P19lc2NhcGVkX2ZyYWdtZW50Xz0" data-attachment-render-hint="2" class="ot-anchor">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ORjM3sxhQrwNI_chlNzYFMD5OFHj7u-Rs_gY4kHkzO0/edit</a></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13rvn0pzm3gvx5or04ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/111828043326914695784_photo.jpg'> Tony Tucker</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-02-03 14:52:15 (edited: 2018-02-03 14:52:15)</cite></p>
        <p>Everything by <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/113864117304127544117" oid="113864117304127544117">Johnstone Metzger</a></span>​. Seriously.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13rvn0pzm3gvx5or04ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/111605721307378944274_photo.jpg'> Chris Whetstone</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-02-03 15:59:13 (edited: 2018-02-03 15:59:13)</cite></p>
        <p>Inverse World has a cool setting and some very very good playbooks, highly recommended</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13rvn0pzm3gvx5or04ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/106984387472795317959_photo.jpg'> Leckie S</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-02-03 17:36:34 (edited: 2018-02-03 17:36:34)</cite></p>
        <p>The Plundergrounds zine by <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/100495092599585582455" oid="100495092599585582455">Ray Otus</a></span> is full of inspirational settings, monsters, and custom moves that always remains faithful to the the tone and style of the core book.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13rvn0pzm3gvx5or04ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/110973090768429200038_photo.jpg'> Marshall Brengle</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-02-03 17:44:44 (edited: 2018-02-03 17:44:44)</cite></p>
        <p>A Sundered World by Awful Good Games (and actually all they’re DW supplements).</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13rvn0pzm3gvx5or04ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/108131264929529993281_photo.jpg'> Lester Ward</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-02-03 18:37:20 (edited: 2018-02-03 18:37:20)</cite></p>
        <p><i>Mounted Combat</i></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13rvn0pzm3gvx5or04ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/110301622772119888974_photo.jpg'> Andrew Huffaker</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-02-03 22:44:53 (edited: 2018-02-03 22:44:53)</cite></p>
        <p>Grim world is also great. And anything else from Lampblack.<br /><br />Also, check out <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/103619294696451727396" oid="103619294696451727396">Joe Banner</a></span> &#39;s releases on drivethru and patreon.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13rvn0pzm3gvx5or04ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/114709511984822898839_photo.jpg'> Erik Buchanan</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-02-04 00:11:16 (edited: 2018-02-04 00:11:16)</cite></p>
        <p>Thanks for all the suggestions. Out of all the PbtA games, does Dungeon World have the most 2nd party books? I had no idea there were so many specific books strictly for DW.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13rvn0pzm3gvx5or04ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/105487846931822189120_photo.jpg'> Robert Doe</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-02-04 01:03:23 (edited: 2018-02-04 01:04:18)</cite></p>
        <p>Id say it does, per year since release at least.<br /><br />Dnd has more easy, but it has decades of time to get there</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13rvn0pzm3gvx5or04ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/103522231327065742687_photo.jpg'> Matthew G.</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-02-04 01:25:03 (edited: 2018-02-04 01:25:03)</cite></p>
        <p>I get a lot of mileage out of <i>The Sprawl</i> by <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/117694340632268764245" oid="117694340632268764245">Hamish Cameron</a></span>. Even if you stick within the fantasy genre, this cyberpunk book is slick with many great elements that can be used in a variety of different games. It’s helped me think more cinematically and more episodically.</p>
</div>
